translations:
Submitted by Posted by By To Category On Last changed
Submit Story Submit comment Submit article Story Stored If necessary, our editors will read through your contribution and approve it before it appears to all users. Comment stored and attached Submit Story Submit article The title of the article Title A title for the comment Title
A description of the contents of the article. This description will usually occur outside of context and must therefore give meaning only along with the title. Max 254 characters. Description
You may here upload a file to the server by using this field or write in a text and a short name underneath. File upload Even if you do not upload a file you will still have to give a name for the article. This will be used in the address etc and must be only lowercase letters and numbers and no spaces. You may concatenate several words. + Article name + The text of the article itself. + Article text
comment Comments comments You respond to this comment: Reply to this Thread below The whole story and all comments
First paragraph Enter the first paragraph or so here. This will appear on lists of stories, with links on to the rest.
The content Enter the rest of the content.
A descriptive image The address of a descriptive image.
Linktext A good, descriptive text to be used for the link to the rest of the story. "Read More" is a common, but very bad choice.
Categorised content Primary Category Give the primary categorization for the story. Uses a controlled vocabulary.
Natural language Give the language in which the article is written.
Section Choose the section to post the article to. A newly posted article will be added to a separate section for editor's approval. The editor must move it over to the appropriate section when the article is approved.
Editor's approval Check to approve for publication.
Storyname A short, one-word name for the story. When an unprivileged user posts an article, the article will get a random five-digit number. The editor should replace this with a reasonably descriptive word.
Submitter ID Submitter The username of the person who submitted the story.
Author's ID The username of the author of the article. All authors should be registered within the system.
Full name Username Email Biography URI Homepage Login Password authorization level New Password Register
User name is allready in use or is invalid! User information was successfully stored!
The category name is allready in use! Category information was stored! Problems occured A problem with unknown cause You must either upload a file, or write a short name and the article text in the text field. The articles was not saved as expected. You may try with a different name or contact webmaster
Listing all stories list Overview Article without comments Edit Send Search Preview previous Update Change Repeat not found Suggest missing
Topp Me for to or and with just new
News Articles Sections Classifications categories Angles of view User Categories Review posts New user User Information
Choose a single-word username. It can be up to 8 characters, and use only lower-case letters from a-z. Your username will also appear in the address of comments you post. Give your full name A valid e-mail address. Your password will be sent to this address. The address of your homepage A short text that describes you
To change password, enter new password twice
The authorization level determines what kind of actions you are allowed to do.
The password is recognized as valid. The password you gave has not been recognized as valid. The username you gave does not match that of any users of this system. Return to main page of the page you came from New category Short version of the category name Choose a short version of the name for the category. Must be a single word, can be up to 15 characters, and use only lower-case letters from a-z. This name will also often appear in the address of pages.
Category name The name of the category as it will be displayed to readers of the page. To identify things by the use of so-called URIs is an important thing in the future of the web. It is wise to choose terms from e.g. WordNet, but if you really don't know what we're talking about here, you may want to leave it to the administrator. Type of category One can make new categories, either as free subject terms, as part of a vocabulary for primary or secondary classification or as a section to the news pages. Description A description of the category. This description will often occur outside of context, and should therefore give meaning only along with the name. Max 254 characters.
